title: Your First Program
description: Write a program that displays `Hello, World!` to the console.
instructions: Write code that prints exactly `Hello, World!` to the console using `console.log()`.

hints.text: Make sure to keep the quotes around the text, and don't forget the semicolon at the end!

commonMistakes.consequence: `console.log(Hello, World!);` causes an error because the computer thinks Hello and World are variables.
commonMistakes.correction: Always wrap text in quotes: `console.log('Hello, World!');`

commonMistakes.consequence: While JavaScript is forgiving, omitting semicolons can cause unexpected behavior in complex code.
commonMistakes.correction: Always end statements with a semicolon: `console.log('Hello, World!');`

commonMistakes.consequence: `Console.log` or `console.Log` won't work because JavaScript is case-sensitive.
